alert.note: Alert for Gregg; Smith; Upshur (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 8:13PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Smith, southern Upshur and northwestern Gregg Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 813 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Big Sandy, or 7 miles west of Gladewater, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... White Oak, Gladewater, Gilmer, Big Sandy, Clarksville City, East Mountain, West Mountain, Union Grove, Warren City and Pritchett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern Texas.
